title: Chelsea transfer news: Isco will force summer exit, says Terry Gibson | Metro News
text:
Follow us Terry Gibson insists Isco too good to sit on the Real Madrid bench amid Chelsea transfer rumours Coral Barry for Metro.co.uk Monday 27 Feb 2017 9:20 pm Isco has been linked with a move away from Real Madrid (Picture: Getty) 
Isco will know it is time to leave Real Madrid this summer, according to Terry Gibson. Jurgen Klopp sends warning to his Liverpool flops after Leicester loss 
The La Liga pundit believes the playmaker could make it into any of the top side’s starting elevens outside of Madrid and expects Isco to force an exit from Real. 
Chelsea were reported to have approached Isco about a potential summer switch while Arsenal are also thought to be monitoring the Spaniard’s situation. 
Isco has made 25 appearances for Real this season, but Gibson believes he is ‘wasted’ with the Spanish giants. 
‘Isco is a super player,’ Gibson told Sky Sports. Chelsea fixtures 
West Ham (A) – Mon 6 Mar Manchester Utd – FA Cup (H) – Mon 13 Mar Stoke (A) – Sat 18 Mar Crystal Palace (H) – Sat 1 Apr Manchester City (H) – Wed 5 Apr Bournemouth (A) – Sat 8 Apr Manchester United (A) – Sat 15 Apr Isco is 25 in April (Picture: Getty) 
‘I can’t imagine Isco being at Real Madrid next season because he’s too good to be wasted. 
‘I know he is arguably at the biggest club in the world but when push comes to shove with these players at Real Madrid they just about accept the rotation so long as they get enough playing time.’ 
Despite the fact Luka Modric and Casemiro are ahead of Isco in the midfield pecking order, Gibson says at any other club the midfielder is first-choice. Chelsea reportedly want Isco at Stamford Bridge (Picture: Getty) 
And as Isco approaches 25, Gibson warned he cannot afford to stay at Real. 
‘The problem, which has also been a problem in recent seasons at Barcelona, is when the big games come and the preferred starting XI is chosen, leaving the likes of Isco out of the team.
